analyzed: rkang pa bteg na ni sor bzhi tsam par ces byed cing /

analyzed: padma sna tshogs dag gis kun tu gang ba yin no //

analyzed: shing ljon pa re re'i dri rgya chen po lha'i las 'das pas kyang dpag tshad 'bum du khyab par byed cing shing ljon pa de dag la lha'i rgyan dag kyang mngon par rab tu 'phyang ngo //

analyzed: shing ljon pa de dag gi bar dag na rin po che sna bdun gyi khang pa brtsegs pa 'phang du ni dpag tshad lnga brgya /

analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa de dag kun la'ang phyogs bzhin rta babs dag yod do //

analyzed: rta @213b babs de dag gi nang rol /

analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa de dag gi phyi rol na rdzing bu srid du ni dpag tshad brgyad cu /

analyzed: rjed  bu de dag kyang khor yug tu me tog autpa la dang / padma dag gis kun nas yog ste /

analyzed: me tog re re la'ang rgyar ni dpag tshad tsam yod do //

analyzed: de dag gis me tog kha zums pa rnams mngon par 'byed par byed cing /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang ting nge 'dzin de las langs te /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: rgyar ni dpag tshad lnga brgya /

analyzed: byang chub kyi shing de'i drung na dngul las byas pa'i padma sdong bu'i 'phang du ni dpag tshad lnga brgya yod la /

analyzed: de'i 'dab ma ni gser las byas pa bye ba phrag 'bum yod de /

analyzed: ze ba rnams ni rin po che sna bdun las byas pa ste /

translated: and seven yojanas wide.

translated: There the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, Padmaśrī, attained the highest complete enlightenment.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdan padma de'i kho ra khor yug na'ang padma dag yod de /

analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' rin po che rnam par snang byed kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Ratnaprabhāsa said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: rigs @215a *// kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs @215a *// kyi bu /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas padma dam pa ni mdang gi nam gyi thun tha ma la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /

translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Saṃkusumita, in the last part of the night, fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

analyzed: da nang nang par gyi dus kyi tshe 'di lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par mdzad de /

translated: He manifested himself up to the Brahma realm, and from the crown of his head he emitted a hundred thousand quintillion light rays.

translated: Those light rays pervade and illuminate the worlds above, as many as there are atoms in a buddha-field.

translated: At that time, the bodhisattvas who are dwelling above, looking down, do not see Mount Meru, the outer ring of mountains, the great outer ring of mountains, or the black mountains.

translated: In those worlds, the bodhisattvas who have received predictions, who have attained meditative stabilization, who have attained retention, who have attained acceptance, who have gone beyond the stages,

analyzed: de na gang dag skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang snang ba des khyab par gyur nas thal mo sbyar te /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @215b sangs rgyas padma dam pa de'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus legs par brgyan pa'i sku'ang mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @215b sangs rgyas padma dam pa de'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus legs par brgyan pa'i sku'ang mthong /
translated: They saw the body of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Saṃkusumitarājendra, who was adorned with the thirty-two major marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor de dang / 'jig rten gyi khams padma'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'ang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor de dang / 'jig rten gyi khams padma'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'ang mthong ngo //
translated: They also saw the assembly of bodhisattvas and the array of qualities of the buddha realm of the Lotus world system.

original: mthong nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag mchog tu dga' ba dang / bde ba skyes te /

original: thag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go //

translated: As soon as they hear this dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience, they will not turn back from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: yi ger 'dri bar byed na'ang sangs rgyas la lta ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge @225b 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar dang mi 'bral lo //
analyzed: yi ger 'dri bar byed na'ang sangs rgyas la lta ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge @225b 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar dang mi 'bral lo //
translated: Even if they write it down, they will not be separated from seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, serving the Saṅgha, and so forth, up to unsurpassed and perfect nirvāṇa.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di kha ton tu byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni las dang po rnams ma lus par zad par byed cing tsho brjes nas kyang sa dang po gnon par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di kha ton tu byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni las dang po rnams ma lus par zad par byed cing tsho brjes nas kyang sa dang po gnon par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who recites this dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience will completely exhaust all the actions of beginners and, after changing lives, will attain the first ground.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di sgom par byed na /🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' de la mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas shing bsags pa zhig yod na'ang de'i las de dag yongs su zad cing gang gi phyir tshe brjes na'angs dang po gnon par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di sgom par byed na / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de la mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas shing bsags pa zhig yod na'ang de'i las de dag yongs su zad cing gang gi phyir tshe brjes na'angs dang po gnon par byed do //
translated: If the bodhisattva-mahāsattva meditates on this dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience,🔽even if that bodhisattva has committed and accumulated the five heinous actions, those actions will be completely exhausted and, after changing lives, he will attain the first ground.

original: gang la mtshams med pa'i las rnams med pa de ni tshe 'di nyid la las gzhan thams cad ma lus par zad cing tshe ba rjes nas kyang sa dang po gnon par byed do //
analyzed: gang la mtshams med pa'i las rnams med pa de ni tshe 'di nyid la las gzhan thams cad ma lus par zad cing tshe ba rjes nas kyang sa dang po gnon par byed do //
translated: For one who does not have the five heinous actions, all other actions will be completely exhausted in this very life and, after changing lives, he will attain the first ground.

original: gang sgom par mi byed //
analyzed: gang sgom par mi byed //
translated: He does not meditate on anything.🔽He does not recite, but he listens and he gives a gift of cloth to the Dharma teacher.

original: kha ton tu mi byed kyang nyan cing chos smra ba la dar gyis 'ching ba byed na de la 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes apa rnams kyi kyang legs
analyzed: kha ton tu mi byed kyang nyan cing chos smra ba la dar gyis 'ching ba byed na de la 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes apa rnams kyi kyang legs
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, as many as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, who dwell and maintain themselves in other world systems, will give him

original: so zhes bya ba sbyin par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: so zhes bya ba sbyin par 'gyur zhing /
translated: the gift of “Excellent!”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston te /
translated: Those Blessed Buddhas will prophesy his unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni der yongs su btang bas ring por mig @226a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni der yongs su btang bas ring por mig @226a *//
translated: That bodhisattva, having been sent there, will not be delayed for long

original: thogs par rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur zhing /
analyzed: thogs par rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur zhing /
translated: before being anointed as crown prince.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu skye ba gcig gis thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu skye ba gcig gis thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be delayed for only one lifetime before unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.”

original: de bzhin du gang la la chos smra ba la spos kyis mchod pa byed na de'ang ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi spos 'thob bo //

translated: Likewise, whoever makes offerings of incense to the Dharma teacher will before long attain the incense of unexcelled, right, perfect enlightenment.

original: chos smra ba la me tog gis mchod pa byed na bla na med pa ye shes kyi me tog dag 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos smra ba la me tog gis mchod pa byed na bla na med pa ye shes kyi me tog dag 'thob bo //
translated: Whoever makes offerings of flowers to the Dharma teacher will attain the flowers of unexcelled wisdom.

original: chos smra ba la 'bras chan dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dag byin na de bzhin gshegs pa'i zas bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos smra ba la 'bras chan dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dag byin na de bzhin gshegs pa'i zas bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever gives rice, food, and drink to the Dharma teacher will attain the unexcelled food of the Tathagata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba la gos kyis bkab na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdog bla na med pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba la gos kyis bkab na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdog bla na med pa 'thob bo //
translated: The bodhisattva who covers the Dharma teacher with clothing will attain the unexcelled complexion of the Tathagata.

original: gang zhig chos smra ba la rin po che dag gis 'gengs par byed na de'ang ring po mi thogs par byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rin po che rnams 'thob ste /
analyzed: gang zhig chos smra ba la rin po che dag gis 'gengs par byed na de'ang ring po mi thogs par byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rin po che rnams 'thob ste /
translated: Whoever fills the Dharma teacher with jewels will before long attain the jewels of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa de ni de ltar don che ba yin no //

translated: The gateway to the dhāraṇī of omniscience of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is thus of great meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thams cad der bstan pas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa 'thob cing yid @226b du'ong ba'i chos bzhi'ang
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thams cad der bstan pas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa 'thob cing yid @226b du'ong ba'i chos bzhi'ang
translated: Why is that?

original: 'thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entire bodhisattva canon is taught in it. This gateway to the dhāraṇī of omniscience causes bodhisattva mahāsattvas to attain unobstructed eloquence and to attain the four types of mental retention.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa de dag gis
analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa de dag gis
translated: when the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Sublime Moon taught the gateway to the dhāraṇī of omniscience to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sky Seal,

original: gtams pa de nyid kyi tshe'ang de bzhin du sa g-yos par gyur cing /
analyzed: gtams pa de nyid kyi tshe'ang de bzhin du sa g-yos par gyur cing /
translated: At that very moment, the earth shook in the same way,

analyzed: 'jig rten du snang ba chen po'ang byung bar gyur te /
translated: and a great light appeared in the world.

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag kyang snang ba rgya chen pos khyab par gyur to //

original: de bzhin du sa phyogs mi mnyam pa dag kyang lag mthil ltar mnyam par snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa phyogs mi mnyam pa dag kyang lag mthil ltar mnyam par snang ngo //
translated: The uneven parts of the earth appeared to be as level as the palm of a hand.

original: der byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'dus pa de dag gis kyang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong bar gyur to //

translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who had gathered there saw the bhagavān buddhas in the buddha realms in the ten directions, beyond any count.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag nas byang chub sems dpa' bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pa
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag nas byang chub sems dpa' bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pa
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas beyond number from buddha realms beyond number in the ten directions have come to the world of Candana in order to see, pay homage to, and serve the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Sublime Moon

original: la phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di nyid kyang mnyan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams tsandan du @227a *//
analyzed: la phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di nyid kyang mnyan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams tsandan du @227a *//
translated: and to listen to this very dhāraṇī gateway of the aspect of omniscience.

original: lhags so // rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: lhags so // rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Sublime Moon then said to the bodhisattva great beings,

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: ‘Sons of noble family,

original: ngas mngon par shes te /
analyzed: ngas mngon par shes te /
translated: I have understood

original: gang dag skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems kyis bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag 'da' bar byed do //
analyzed: gang dag skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni 'gog pa la mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems kyis bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag 'da' bar byed do //
translated: These bodhisattvas who are impeded by one birth spend these ten intermediate eons in a state of mind that is absorbed in cessation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag ma rnams kyis ni bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag ma rnams kyis ni bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag la /
translated: The remaining bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya 'di las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi chos 'di nyid thos  par gyur cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya 'di las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi chos 'di nyid thos  par gyur cing /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśamudrā, will hear this Dharma discourse of the bodhisattva canon called The Bodhisattvas’ Entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience.

original: bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag la chos rnams thos nas kyang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa de dag na /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag la chos rnams thos nas kyang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa de dag na /
translated: Having heard this Dharma during these ten intermediate eons, they will then, in the buddha realms of the ten directions that are beyond count,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la /
translated: “There are more than a hundred thousand buddhas, bhagavats, who are present, live, remain, and are present in the world systems of the ten directions.

original: de dag sems mngon par rab tu dang bar byas te sems rab tu dang pa'i rgyu des dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag sems mngon par rab tu dang bar byas te sems rab tu dang pa'i rgyu des dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par gyur nas /
translated: They have generated roots of virtue through the cause of the mind of faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pa la @227b mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pa la @227b mchod pa byas nas /
translated: They have made offerings to the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candrasūryapradīpa through various kinds of bodhisattva manifestations.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad du /
translated: They have said to the Bhagavān:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‘Bhagavān,🔽will this bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśagarbha turn the irreversible wheel of the Dharma?🔽Will he make the supreme offering to the Tathāgata?🔽Will he purify the Buddha’s conduct?🔽Will he purify the bodhisattva conduct?

original: bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag 'das nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya 'di chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor bar 'gyur lags sam zhes gsol pa dang / bka' stsal pa /🔽rigs kyi bu dag //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag 'das nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya 'di chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor bar 'gyur lags sam zhes gsol pa dang / bka' stsal pa / rigs kyi bu dag //
translated: Will he purify the conduct of the pratyekabuddhas?🔽Will he purify the conduct of the śrāvakas?🔽Will he purify the conduct of the ordinary person?’

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: “The Bhagavān said, ‘Noble sons, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “It is just as you have said.

original: bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag 'das nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa bcu po 'di dag 'das nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: After ten intermediate eons have passed, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśamudrā will attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: de gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur pa de nyid kyi nub mo 'das nas chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur pa de nyid kyi nub mo 'das nas chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: On the very night that he attains the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, after that night has passed, he will turn the wheel of the Dharma that is endowed with the Dharma.

original: der byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bar gyi bskal pa bcur thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bar gyi bskal pa bcur thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, for ten intermediate eons, he will teach this very Dharma discourse that is the dhāraṇī gateway of omniscience to the bodhisattvas.

original: de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag de la chos nyan par 'gyur ba de dag ni chos de thos pas dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed nas /
analyzed: de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag de la chos nyan par 'gyur ba de dag ni chos de thos pas dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed nas /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who listen to the Dharma there, having heard that Dharma, will give rise to roots of virtue.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i phyag rgya bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i phyag rgya bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the bodhisattva Ākāśamudrā will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,

original: des byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo /
analyzed: des byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo /
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, he will turn the wheel of the Dharma endowed with Dharma,

original: rab mchog gi @228a *//
analyzed: rab mchog gi @228a *//
translated: the supreme wheel,

original: 'khor lo / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: 'khor lo / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: the irreversible wheel,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po rnams phyir mi ldog pa la bkod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po rnams phyir mi ldog pa la bkod cing /
translated: and will establish many hundred thousand quintillions of bodhisattvas in irreversibility.

original: der bar gyi bskal pa bcur thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i chos 'di ston pa na byang chub sems dpa' de dag de las nyan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: der bar gyi bskal pa bcur thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i chos 'di ston pa na byang chub sems dpa' de dag de las nyan par 'gyur te /
translated: For ten intermediate eons, while teaching this Dharma that is the gateway to the dhāraṇī of omniscience, those bodhisattvas will listen to it.

original: de'i tshe de dag gis chos thos nas skye ba gcig gis thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gis chos thos nas skye ba gcig gis thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, having heard the Dharma, they will be impeded by only one birth.

original: gang dag bskal par nyan par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni de'i tshe nas las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang dag bskal par nyan par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni de'i tshe nas las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who listen for an eon will, at that time, transcend their karma.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te de nyid kyi tshe na gzungs 'di'ang mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te de nyid kyi tshe na gzungs 'di'ang mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and at that time they will also attain the culmination of this dhāraṇī.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la de skad ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la de skad ces bka' stsal te /
translated: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Sublime Moon spoke thus to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi cho 'phrul sna tshogs dag yang dag par bstan nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya la ting nge 'dzin sred med kyi bu zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi cho 'phrul sna tshogs dag yang dag par bstan nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya la ting nge 'dzin sred med kyi bu zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: Having displayed various miracles in the domain of the Buddha, he taught the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśamudrā the meditative absorption called Nārāyaṇa,

original: lus rdo rje lta bur byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'od bkod pa zhes bya ba nges par ston cing /
analyzed: lus rdo rje lta bur byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'od bkod pa zhes bya ba nges par ston cing /
translated: which blesses the body to be like a vajra, and he revealed the meditative absorption called Array of Light.

original: der bar gyi bskal pa bcur byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa @228b nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i chos bstan pa 'dis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: der bar gyi bskal pa bcur byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa @228b nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i chos bstan pa 'dis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: For ten intermediate eons, he turned the wheel of Dharma by teaching the bodhisattvas this Dharma that is the gateway to the dhāraṇī of omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa dag gsal zhing snang bar byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nges par ston cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa dag gsal zhing snang bar byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nges par ston cing /
translated: He illuminated and made manifest the bodies of the buddhas, adorned with the major and minor marks, in all buddha realms, and he revealed the meditative absorption called Vajra Center.

original: des byang chub kyi gdan la chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu bskor te byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos ston par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'khor lo'i phreng ba zhes bya ba nges par ston cing /
analyzed: des byang chub kyi gdan la chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu bskor te byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos ston par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'khor lo'i phreng ba zhes bya ba nges par ston cing /
translated: He turned the wheel of Dharma on the seat of awakening and taught the Dharma to the bodhisattvas, revealing the absorption known as the garland of wheels.🔽When he turned the wheel of Dharma, he knew that many trillions of beings would turn the wheel of Dharma themselves and would reach the stage of irreversibility.

original: de chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba na srog chags bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po rnams kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa nyid la 'god par rig nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya
analyzed: de chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba na srog chags bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po rnams kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa nyid la 'god par rig nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya
translated: The bodhisattva great being Ākāśamudrā

original: dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dpag tu med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dpag tu med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas /
translated: and an immeasurable saṅgha of bodhisattvas made offerings to the Blessed One,

original: rang rang gi khang pa brtsegs pa dag tu zhugs te 'dug go /
analyzed: rang rang gi khang pa brtsegs pa dag tu zhugs te 'dug go /
translated: and then they each entered their own kūṭāgāra and sat down.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pa'ang de nyid kyi nub mo phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zla ba dam pa'ang de nyid kyi nub mo phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: The Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Excellent Moon, on that very night, passed into parinirvana in the realm of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas /
translated: Those bodhisattvas, after that very night had passed,

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i sku gdung la mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i sku gdung la mchod pa byas te /
translated: made offerings to the relics of that Bhagavat

original: rang rang gi khang pa brtsegs pa dag tu zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: rang rang gi khang pa brtsegs pa dag tu zhugs par gyur to //
translated: and entered their own kūṭāgāras.

original: byang @229a *// chub sems dpa' gzhan dag ni rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du dong ngo //
analyzed: byang @229a *// chub sems dpa' gzhan dag ni rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du dong ngo //
translated: Other bodhisattvas went to their own buddha-fields.

original: de na gang dag skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid kyis bar gyi bskal pa bcu po de dag 'da' bar byed do //
analyzed: de na gang dag skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid kyis bar gyi bskal pa bcu po de dag 'da' bar byed do //
translated: There, those bodhisattvas who were obstructed by only one birth spent those ten intermediate eons in the attainment of cessation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams las brtsams te chos ston par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i phyag rgya ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams las brtsams te chos ston par byed cing /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśamudrā taught the Dharma, beginning with the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang bar gyi bskal pa bcur dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang bar gyi bskal pa bcur dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas generated roots of virtue for ten intermediate eons.

original: mdang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: mdang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Last night he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: des da nang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te cho 'phrul chen po bstan nas /
analyzed: des da nang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te cho 'phrul chen po bstan nas /
translated: This morning he turned the wheel of the Dharma and displayed great miracles.

analyzed: srog chags bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod do //
translated: He has established many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig sa ya phrag brgyad kyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig sa ya phrag brgyad kyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: When this dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience was explained, 8,000,000,000,000 bodhisattvas attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: srog chags dung phyur phrag dgu dang bye ba phrag gnyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa la bkod do //
analyzed: srog chags dung phyur phrag dgu dang bye ba phrag gnyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa la bkod do //
translated: 92,000,000,000 beings were established in irreversibility from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i @229b gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i gzungs 'di thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i @229b gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i gzungs 'di thob bo //
translated: 72,000,000,000 bodhisattvas attained this dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience.

original: lha dang mi bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa rnams kyis de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: lha dang mi bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa rnams kyis de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Incalculable gods and humans generated the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin po che rnam par snang byed kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin po che rnam par snang byed kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ratnaprabhāsa made a request to the Bhagavān:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos du dang ldan na gzungs 'di 'thob lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos du dang ldan na gzungs 'di 'thob lags /
translated: how many qualities should a bodhisattva mahāsattva have in order to attain this dhāraṇī?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na gzungs 'di 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na gzungs 'di 'thob ste /
translated: a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has four qualities will attain this dhāraṇī.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la legs par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la legs par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is well-established in the four noble families.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gos ngan ngon tsam gyis dga' zhing chog shes la /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gos ngan ngon tsam gyis dga' zhing chog shes la /
translated: What are the four?

original: gos ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod par byed cing /
analyzed: gos ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod par byed cing /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is content with just the bare necessities of clothing and praises being content with just the bare necessities of clothing.

original: de gos kyi phyir tshul dang mi mthun par mi byed la /
analyzed: de gos kyi phyir tshul dang mi mthun par mi byed la /
translated: He does not act contrary to the Dharma for the sake of clothing.

original: gos ma rnyed na'ang yongs su gdung ba med cing /
analyzed: gos ma rnyed na'ang yongs su gdung ba med cing /
translated: If he does not obtain clothing, he is not distressed.

original: gos rnyed na'ang chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'khren pa med pa dang / mdud pa por ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med par yongs su spyod par byed cing /🔽nyes dmigs su lta la nges par 'byung bar rab tu shes @230a *//
analyzed: gos rnyed na'ang chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'khren pa med pa dang / mdud pa por ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med par yongs su spyod par byed cing / nyes dmigs su lta la nges par 'byung bar rab tu shes @230a *//
translated: If he obtains clothing, he uses it without attachment, without clinging, without being tied to it, without being infatuated with it, without being greedy for it, without being greedy on account of it,

original: shing yongs su spyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: shing yongs su spyod par byed pa ste /
translated: seeing the drawbacks, understanding emancipation, and using it for the sake of emancipation.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i rigs la legs par gnas pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i rigs la legs par gnas pa dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first noble family of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: gos la ji lta ba bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan la'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gos la ji lta ba bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan la'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with clothing, so it is with alms-food, a bed and seat, and medicine for curing the sick.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ngan ngon ca tsam gyis dga' zhing chog shes la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ngan ngon ca tsam gyis dga' zhing chog shes la /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is content with just the bare necessities of medicine and provisions for the sick, and

original: na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa'i bsngags pa'ang rjod par byed cing de na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad kyi phyir tshul dang mi mthun pa 'tshol bar mi byed la /
analyzed: na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa'i bsngags pa'ang rjod par byed cing de na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad kyi phyir tshul dang mi mthun pa 'tshol bar mi byed la /
translated: he praises being content with just the bare necessities of medicine and provisions for the sick. He does not seek out what is unsuitable for the sake of medicine and provisions for the sick.

original: de na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ma rnyed na'ang yongs su gdung ba med cing rnyed na'ang chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'khren pa med pa dang / mdud pa bor ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ma rnyed na'ang yongs su gdung ba med cing rnyed na'ang chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'khren pa med pa dang / mdud pa bor ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang /
translated: Even if he does not obtain medicine and provisions for the sick, he is not distressed. Even if he does obtain them, he does not use them with attachment, clinging, craving, knots, fainting,

original: lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med par yongs su spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med par yongs su spyod par byed cing /
translated: excessive attachment, or excessive attachment arising.

original: nyes dmigs su lta ba la nges par 'byung ba rab tu shes shing yongs su spyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyes dmigs su lta ba la nges par 'byung ba rab tu shes shing yongs su spyod par byed pa ste /
translated: They are to have the insight of renunciation with regard to the view of faults, and to engage in thorough practice.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po de dag la legs par gnas shing /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po de dag la legs par gnas shing /
translated: They are to be well established in the four noble lineages.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzungs 'di thob cing sgom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzungs 'di thob cing sgom par byed pa yin no //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who possess these four qualities will attain and cultivate this dhāraṇī.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems @230b dpa' chen po chos lnga dang ldan na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i gzungs 'di 'thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems @230b dpa' chen po chos lnga dang ldan na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa'i gzungs 'di 'thob ste /
translated: “Moreover, if bodhisattva great beings possess five qualities, they will attain this dhāraṇī that is the gateway to the dhāraṇī of the aspects of omniscience.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are those five?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag kyang tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so so thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la'ang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag kyang tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so so thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la'ang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: are perfect in their conduct and sphere of activity, and regard even the slightest unwholesome act with fear.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed la /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed la /
translated: They take up the bases of training and train in them.

original: gzhan tshul khrims dang bral pa dag mthong na'ang tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan tshul khrims dang bral pa dag mthong na'ang tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
translated: When they see others who are without discipline, they cause them to take up perfect discipline and they train them, introduce them, and establish them in it.🔽Bodhisattva great beings who have these first qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dang po de dag ldan pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can lta ba la zhen par gyur pa rnams log par lta ba las rnam par bslang zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dang po de dag ldan pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can lta ba la zhen par gyur pa rnams log par lta ba las rnam par bslang zhing /
translated: and also bodhisattva great beings who cause beings who are attached to views to give up wrong views,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
translated: They cause them to take up the correct view and they train them, introduce them, and establish them in it.🔽“Bodhisattva great beings endowed with those two dharmas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis pa de dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can cho ga ma yin pa la zhen par gyur pa rnams yang dag pa'i cho ga yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis pa de dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can cho ga ma yin pa la zhen par gyur pa rnams yang dag pa'i cho ga yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
translated: also cause sentient beings who are attached to incorrect ritual to take up the correct ritual.

original: 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
translated: They train them, introduce them, and establish them in it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gsum @231a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gsum @231a *//
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings endowed with those three dharmas

original: pa de dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can bsam pa nyams par gyur pa rnams bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
analyzed: pa de dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can bsam pa nyams par gyur pa rnams bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
translated: also cause sentient beings whose intentions are impaired to take up perfect intentions.

original: 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /
translated: They train them, introduce them, and establish them in it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi po de dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la 'dul zhing 'dzud la rab tu 'god par byed pa ste /

analyzed: de dag gis kyang de bzhin du phul lo //
translated: They also offered them in the same way.

analyzed: khyim bdag rin po ches kyang skyed mos tshal bzang po thams cad dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas shing skyed mos tshal de nyid du /
translated: The precious householder also made all the beautiful parks out of the gold of the Jambū River and in those parks

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir rin po che sna bdun gyi khang ba brtsegs pa brtsigs te /

analyzed: de'i phyogs bzhi khor khor yug dag tu rin po che sna bdun gyi sgo dag kyang gtod do //

analyzed: skyed mos tshal thams cad kyang rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa dag gis brgyan to //

analyzed: shing ljon pa de dag kyang gos sna tshogs dang / ras bcos bu sna tshogs dang / gdugs sna tshogs dang / mu tig gi lnga ldi sna tshogs dang / rgyan sna tshogs dang / rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs dang / spos sna tshogs dag gis legs par brgyan to //
translated: Those trees were well adorned with various garments, various fine cottons, various parasols, various pearl garlands, various ornaments, various precious ornaments, and various fragrances.

analyzed: shing ljon pa de dag rin po che'i me tog dang / 'bras bu thams cad kyis kyang brgyan to //
translated: Those trees were also adorned with all precious flowers and fruits.

analyzed: skyed mos tshal de dag thams cad nor bu rnam pa du ma dag gis kyang @242a *//
translated: All those parks were also adorned with many kinds of jewels.

analyzed: brgyan nas me tog sna tshogs bkram zhing dar dang / ras bcos bu dang / be'u ras dang / bgo ba sna tshogs dag gi gdan dag kyang bshams so //

analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che de'ang khang pa brtsegs pa'i phyi rol gyi steng gi bar snang la mi'i tshad tsam du red de /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bab par 'bar zhing 'dug go //

analyzed: glang po rin po che thal kar yan lag bdun legs par gnas pa'ang bcom ldan 'das kyi snam logs na /
translated: The precious elephant, white with seven well-proportioned limbs, was behind the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi steng du rin po che'i shing ljon pa 'dzin cing 'dug ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi steng du rin po che'i shing ljon pa 'dzin cing 'dug ste /

analyzed: rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyi btsun mo dam pa gang yin pa de'ang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tsandan sa mchog pa dang / tsandan sbrul gyi snying po'i phye ma dag 'thor bar byed do //

analyzed: rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyi nor bu rin po che 'od gsal bar gyur pa gang yin pa de'ang rang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bzhag go /
translated: The king’s clear-shining precious jewel was also placed before the Blessed One.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de thams cad rtag par rgyun du khyab par gyur to //
translated: The light of the Buddha constantly pervaded the entire trichiliocosm.

analyzed: nyan thos re re la'ang tsandan sa mchog pa'i rkang rten dag bzhag go /

analyzed: nyan thos re re'i mdun du'ang bu mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa dag bkod nas tsandan sa mchog pa'i phye ma dag kyang 'thor bar byed do //

analyzed: nyan thos re re'i mdun du nor bu beed'urya dag kyang bzhag go /

translated: Outside the pleasure grove, on the outer perimeter, the precious minister, together with the four divisions of the army, was stationed.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

analyzed: de nas rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud de bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir nyin gcig bzhin du grong khyer nas byung ste /
translated: King Cakraviṃśa, in order to see the Blessed One and to serve him, would leave the city every day.

original: de bzhon pas bgrod pa'i sa ji srid pa de srid du bzhon pas song nas bzhon pa las babs te /
analyzed: de bzhon pas bgrod pa'i sa ji srid pa de srid du bzhon pas song nas bzhon pa las babs te /

original: rkang pas skyed mos tshal du zhugs so //
analyzed: rkang pas skyed mos tshal du zhugs so //
translated: He would enter the pleasure grove on foot.

original: zhugs nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i snying po ga la ba der song ste phyin pa dang / de bzhin @243a *//
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i snying po ga la ba der song ste phyin pa dang / de bzhin @243a *//

analyzed: gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i snying po'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /

analyzed: lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /

analyzed: rang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i snying po la phyag chab gsol te /

analyzed: bdag nyid lag dar nas bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / bldag pa dang / bsod pa mang po dag legs par bstabs shing tshim par byas so //

analyzed: bdag nyid lag dar te legs par bstabs shing tshim par byas nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag nas lhung bzed bzhag ste phyag bcabs par rig nas /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bsil yab blangs te bcom ldan 'das la g-yabs so //
translated: he himself took a fan and fanned the Blessed One.

analyzed: rgyal bu stong dang / khams kyi rgyal po stong gis kyang nyan thos re re la de lta bu'i bsnyen bkur byas nas bsil yab blangs te nyan thos rnams la g-yabs so //
translated: The thousand princes and the thousand regional kings, after serving and satisfying each of the disciples in the same way, took fans and fanned the disciples.

analyzed: zhal zas brim pa rdzogs te gdugs tshod rgyu ma thag tu srog chags bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag kyang chos mnyan pa'i phyir kun dga' ra bar lhags so //
translated: As soon as the meal was served, many hundreds of thousands of millions of living beings came to the garden to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: lha bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag gis kyang nam mkha'i dkyil nas me tog gi char dag mngon par rab tu phab nas /

original: lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag kyang rab tu bsgrags so //
analyzed: lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag kyang rab tu bsgrags so //

original: lha'i gdugs dang / gos dang / rgyan dag kyang rab tu dpyangs so //
analyzed: lha'i gdugs dang / gos dang / rgyan dag kyang rab tu dpyangs so //

analyzed: gnod sbyin gos sngon po can sa @243b ya phrag bzhis kyang bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun bsrung ba'i phyir tsandan gyi tshal nas tsandan sa mchog ba'i sdong po dag blangs nas thun du blags te mel tshe byed de /
translated: Four hundred thousand blue-clad yakṣas, in order to protect the Blessed One and the saṅgha of monks, took sandalwood trees from the sandalwood forest and stood guard in shifts.

original: rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud nyid kyis kyang mtshan mo bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams kyi spyan sngar mar me kha bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag bus so //
analyzed: rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud nyid kyis kyang mtshan mo bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams kyi spyan sngar mar me kha bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag bus so //
translated: King Cakravar-tin, himself, also lit up many hundreds of thousands of myriads of myriads of kotis of lamps in the presence of the Lord and the community of monks during the night.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de nas rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas mgo'i steng du'ang mar me'i kong bu gcig bzhag /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas mgo'i steng du'ang mar me'i kong bu gcig bzhag /

analyzed: phrag pa gnyis dang / lag pa gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis su'ang mar me'i kong bu re re bzhag ste /
translated: and also placed one lamp-bowl on each of his two shoulders, two hands, and two feet.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mtshan yal nangs su mar me btang yang bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus lus la ngal ba med cing /
translated: Although he lit the lamps in the presence of the Lord during the night until dawn, by the power of the Lord, his body was not tired.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It was like this:

original: dper na / dge slong bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de lta bur lus kyi bde ba tshor bar gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / dge slong bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de lta bur lus kyi bde ba tshor bar gyur te /
translated: He felt physical bliss, just as a monk who has entered the third dhyana does.

analyzed: de ltar lus ngal ba med pa dang / sems ngal ba med par zla ba gsum du bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: In this way, for three months, they served the Blessed One without physical fatigue and without mental weariness.

original: de bzhin du rgyal bu stong dang / khams kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / gzhan yang srog chags bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyis kyang nyan thos re re la zla ba gsum du rgyal po'i yo byad dang de lta bu'i bsnyen bkur gyis bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal bu stong dang / khams kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / gzhan yang srog chags bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyis kyang nyan thos re re la zla ba gsum du rgyal po'i yo byad dang de lta bu'i bsnyen bkur gyis bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: In the same way, the thousand princes, the eighty-four thousand regional kings, and another trillion living beings each served each of the hearers for three months with the royal requisites and similar honors.

original: ji ltar rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i @244a *//
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i @244a *//

analyzed: snying po la bsnyen bkur byas ba de bzhin du btsun mo dam pa lha mo dpal gyis kyang zla gsum du spos dang / me tog dag gis bsnyen bkur byas so //

original: de bzhin du bu mo bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po dag gis kyang nyan thos re re la zla ba gsum du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dag gis bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bu mo bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po dag gis kyang nyan thos re re la zla ba gsum du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dag gis bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: In the same way, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of girls each served the śrāvakas for three months with flowers, incense, and perfume.

original: rigs kyi bu; de nas rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyi zla ba gsum po 'das nas bcom ldan 'das la dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa'i rgyan brgyad khri bzhi stong phul lo //🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa gser gyi 'khor lo rin po che brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //🔽bcom ldan 'das la glang po rin po che la sogs pa glang po che thal kar brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de nas rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyi zla ba gsum po 'das nas bcom ldan 'das la dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa'i rgyan brgyad khri bzhi stong phul lo // bcom ldan 'das la 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa gser gyi 'khor lo rin po che brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo // bcom ldan 'das la glang po rin po che la sogs pa glang po che thal kar brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
translated: “Noble son, after three months had passed, King Cakravar­tīna presented the Blessed One with eighty-four thousand ornaments made of gold from the Jambū River.🔽He also presented the Blessed One with eighty-four thousand golden precious wheels, including the precious wheel.🔽He also presented the Blessed One with eighty-four thousand white elephants, including the precious elephant.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rta rin po che la sogs pa rta brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
translated: He also presented the Blessed One with eighty-four thousand horses, including the precious horse.

original: bcom ldan 'das la nor bu rin po che la sogs pa nor bu me shel brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la nor bu rin po che la sogs pa nor bu me shel brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
translated: He also offered to the Bhagavān eighty-four thousand precious jewels, including precious jewels and sun-crystal jewels.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir khyim bdag rin po che la sogs pa rgyal bu brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir khyim bdag rin po che la sogs pa rgyal bu brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
translated: He also offered to the Bhagavān eighty-four thousand princes, including the precious householder, in order to serve him.

original: bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir blon po rin po che la sogs pa khams kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir blon po rin po che la sogs pa khams kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
translated: He also offered to the Bhagavān eighty-four thousand regional kings, including the precious minister, in order to serve him.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang / dge @244b slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'tsho ba'i phyir btsun me'i 'khor gyi grong khyer la sogs grong khyer brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / dge @244b slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'tsho ba'i phyir btsun me'i 'khor gyi grong khyer la sogs grong khyer brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul lo //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i snying po la sman bcud kyi len brgyad khri bzhi stong yang phul nas 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bdag ni bgyi ba mang zhing bgyid ba mang ba lags na bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la bzod pa mdzad cing /

analyzed: bdag cag gi skyed mos tshal du bzhugs pa dang / bcom @245a *//
translated: Please stay in our pleasure grove, and

analyzed: gcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi ba'i slad du bdag slad kyis kyang mchi'o //

translated: The one thousand sons of King Ārciṣmān also touched their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet and each of them said to the Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag re res kyang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la dgung zla gsum zhig yo byad thams cad kyi sa bsnyen bkur bgyi bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: bdag cag re res kyang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la dgung zla gsum zhig yo byad thams cad kyi sa bsnyen bkur bgyi bar 'tshal na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag cag la gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag cag la gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: Bhagavān, please grant us this opportunity.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas rgyal bu de dag la gnang bar mdzad do //

original: de nas rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyis gnang bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyis gnang bar rig nas /
translated: Then King Ārciṣmān, knowing that the Bhagavān had assented,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /

analyzed: lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas phyir song ngo //

original: de nas rgyal bu de dag gi thu bo mig mi 'dzum zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la zla ba gsum gyi bar du ji ltar rgyal bo rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyis bsnyen bkur bya ba de lta bu'i bsnyen bkur🔽bya bas bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu de dag gi thu bo mig mi 'dzum zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la zla ba gsum gyi bar du ji ltar rgyal bo rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyis bsnyen bkur bya ba de lta bu'i bsnyen bkur bya bas bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: Then the eldest of the princes, called Akṣanāmā, served the Blessed One and the community of monks for three months with the same kind of service that King Ārṇavamati had offered.

original: rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud kyang bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la lta @245b ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir nyin mo skabs skabs su 'ong ngo //

translated: King Ārṇavamati also came from time to time during the day to see the Blessed One and the community of monks and to listen to the Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i snying po'i yab bram ze rgya mtsho'i rdul ces bya ba de'ang dzambu'i gling thams cad nyul zhing skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dag las zas slong bar byed de //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i snying po'i yab bram ze rgya mtsho'i rdul ces bya ba de'ang dzambu'i gling thams cad nyul zhing skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dag las zas slong bar byed de //
translated: “Son of noble family, then the father of the Tathāgata Ratnasaṃbhava, the brahmin Sāgara­sindhu­vāsa, wandered throughout the whole of Jambudvīpa, begging for food from men, women, boys, and girls.

analyzed: de la zas de sbyin pa na ji srid du khye'u dang / bu mo de dag gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la rab tu 'god cing /

translated: In this way, as he wandered, there was no one in Jambudvīpa whom the brahmin Sāgara­druma did not take care of with food, whom he did not establish in going for refuge to the Three Jewels, whom he did not cause to generate the mind of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment,

original: gang bla na med pa'i ye shes la rab tu ma bkod cing yang dag par 'dzin du ma bcug pa'i mir gyur pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gang bla na med pa'i ye shes la rab tu ma bkod cing yang dag par 'dzin du ma bcug pa'i mir gyur pa 'ga' yang med de /

analyzed: srog chags bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po dag gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas la bkod do //

analyzed: de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de rab tu bkod do //
translated: In the same way, he caused them to take up, enter into, and follow the unsurpassed, supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: rgyal bu gzhon nu mig mi 'dzum gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba gsum du spyan drangs shing /🔽ji ltar rgyal bo rtsibs kyi @246a *//
analyzed: rgyal bu gzhon nu mig mi 'dzum gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba gsum du spyan drangs shing / ji ltar rgyal bo rtsibs kyi @246a *//

analyzed: skar ma 'dud dang / chags med rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du byas te /

translated: The thousand sons of King Ārṣadhara each served the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Ratnaga-tra, together with an immeasurable saṅgha of monks, for three months each
