translated: That tathagata, that arhat, that perfectly enlightened buddha inspired us to take up unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment. He encouraged us, introduced us to it, and established us in it. He placed us in the irreversible state.

original: des da ltar bdag @253b cag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing chos kyi rgyal srid kyang brnyes so zhes khyod kyi bsngags pa brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des da ltar bdag @253b cag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing chos kyi rgyal srid kyang brnyes so zhes khyod kyi bsngags pa brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: They will praise you, saying, ‘Because of him, we have now attained perfect buddhahood and the sovereignty of the Dharma.’

original: bram ze khyod kyi rmi lam de ni de'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: bram ze khyod kyi rmi lam de ni de'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: Brahmin, that is the omen of your dream.”

original: bram ze gang khyod kyi rmi lam na phag gi gdong dang / khyi'i gdong gi bar du gyur cing lus khrag gis bskus te srog chags rnam pa du ma dag zos nas ae randa'i shing ngan pa'i drung na 'dug pa dang / de'ang srog chags rnam pa du ma gzhan dag gis zos shing keng rus kyi bar byas te bor ba dang /
analyzed: bram ze gang khyod kyi rmi lam na phag gi gdong dang / khyi'i gdong gi bar du gyur cing lus khrag gis bskus te srog chags rnam pa du ma dag zos nas ae randa'i shing ngan pa'i drung na 'dug pa dang / de'ang srog chags rnam pa du ma gzhan dag gis zos shing keng rus kyi bar byas te bor ba dang /
translated: “Brahmin, in your dream, you saw a pig’s face, up to a dog’s face, your body smeared with blood, you ate many kinds of living beings, you sat under a bad castor-oil plant, and many other living beings ate you, down to your skeleton, and threw you away.

original: yang lus phyir skyes nas lus khrag gis bskus shing khyi'i gdong gi bar du gyur bas srog chags rnam pa mang po dag zos nas yang ae randa'i shing ngan pa'i drung na 'dug pa dang / srog chags rnam pa du ma dag gis zos par mthong ba ni khyod kyis skyes bu blun pa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum po sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: yang lus phyir skyes nas lus khrag gis bskus shing khyi'i gdong gi bar du gyur bas srog chags rnam pa mang po dag zos nas yang ae randa'i shing ngan pa'i drung na 'dug pa dang / srog chags rnam pa du ma dag gis zos par mthong ba ni khyod kyis skyes bu blun pa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum po sbyin pa dang /
translated: Again, you saw him born as a human, his body covered in blood, with a dog’s face, eating many kinds of animals, and then sitting under a bad castor-oil tree, being eaten by many kinds of animals.

original: dul ba dang / yang dag par sdom pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing rab tu bkod pa de dag lha rnams kyi nang du 'chi 'pho ba'i sdug bsngal 'dod pa dang / mi rnams kyi nang du rga ba dang / na ba dang /
analyzed: dul ba dang / yang dag par sdom pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing rab tu bkod pa de dag lha rnams kyi nang du 'chi 'pho ba'i sdug bsngal 'dod pa dang / mi rnams kyi nang du rga ba dang / na ba dang /
translated: “You saw that because you, a fool, had caused three things to be done for the sake of merit—giving, taming, and taking up perfect restraint—and had established them, those gods were suffering when they died and transmigrated, and humans were suffering from old age, sickness,

original: 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang du bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du gti mug gi mun pa dang /🔽mgo gcod @254a *//
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang du bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du gti mug gi mun pa dang / mgo gcod @254a *//
translated: the suffering of the darkness of delusion among animals,🔽the suffering of being beheaded and so on,🔽and the suffering of various harms and so on in the hells.

original: pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du gnod pa sna tshogs la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'dod par 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa gsum po dag la rab tu bkod pa rnams lha rnams kyi nang du lha'i rgyal srid 'dod la mi rnams kyi nang du ni gling gcig gi dbang phyug 'dod de /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du gnod pa sna tshogs la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'dod par 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa gsum po dag la rab tu bkod pa rnams lha rnams kyi nang du lha'i rgyal srid 'dod la mi rnams kyi nang du ni gling gcig gi dbang phyug 'dod de /
translated: Those who are established in the three types of meritorious activities desire the divine kingdom among the gods and the sovereignty of one continent among humans.

original: de dag der sems can thams cad la longs spyod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag der sems can thams cad la longs spyod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: There they will enjoy all resources for sentient beings.

original: de dag kyang sems can thams cad kyi kha zas dang / longs spyod du 'gyur bas de ltar skyes bu blun po de dag yun ring por 'khor bar sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang sems can thams cad kyi kha zas dang / longs spyod du 'gyur bas de ltar skyes bu blun po de dag yun ring por 'khor bar sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will become the food and wealth of all sentient beings. Thus, those foolish people will experience suffering in cyclic existence for a long time.

original: bram ze khyod kyi rmi lam de ni de'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: bram ze khyod kyi rmi lam de ni de'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: Brahmin, that is the omen of that.

original: bram ze gang khyod kyi rmi lam na mi kha cig sna ma'i me tog gi phreng ba dag gis mgo brgyan cing /🔽ma he'i shing rta dag la zhon te lam gol bar zhugs nas g-yas phyogs su lta zhing dong bar mthong ba de'ang bram ze khyod kyi sa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum po dag la rab tu bkod pa'i rigs kyi bu dag cig bdag dul bar bya
analyzed: bram ze gang khyod kyi rmi lam na mi kha cig sna ma'i me tog gi phreng ba dag gis mgo brgyan cing / ma he'i shing rta dag la zhon te lam gol bar zhugs nas g-yas phyogs su lta zhing dong bar mthong ba de'ang bram ze khyod kyi sa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum po dag la rab tu bkod pa'i rigs kyi bu dag cig bdag dul bar bya
translated: “Brahmin, in your dream you saw some people with their heads adorned with mālatī flower garlands,🔽riding on buffalo carts, entering a wrong path, and looking to the right.

original: ba dang / bdag zhi bar bya ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba dang / bdag zhi bar bya ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur te /
translated: That is also the omen of this. Brahmin, some sons of good family whom you have established in the three bases of meritorious action will enter the vehicle of the hearers solely in order to tame themselves and pacify themselves.

original: bram ze de ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag de dag gi snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: bram ze de ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag de dag gi snga ltas yin no //
translated: This brahmin is a sign of those individuals who are in the Śrāvakayāna.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽de nas bram ze rgya mtsho'i @254b rdul gyis rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / de nas bram ze rgya mtsho'i @254b rdul gyis rgyal po rtsibs kyi mu khyud la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Noble son,

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: the brahmin Sāgara­druma then said to King Ārṇava­ratha, ‘Great King,

original: mir skye ba ni rnyed par dka'/
analyzed: mir skye ba ni rnyed par dka'/
translated: it is difficult to obtain a human birth.

original: dal ba phun sum tshogs pa'ang rnyed par dka'/
analyzed: dal ba phun sum tshogs pa'ang rnyed par dka'/
translated: It is difficult to obtain the perfect freedoms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba'ang au dumba ra'i me tog ltar rnyed par dka'/
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba'ang au dumba ra'i me tog ltar rnyed par dka'/
translated: It is difficult to obtain the appearance in the world of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas, who are as rare as the uḍumbara flower.

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'ang rnyed par dka'/
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'ang rnyed par dka'/
translated: It is difficult to obtain the aspiration for virtuous qualities.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam yang rnyed par dka' lags so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam yang rnyed par dka' lags so //
translated: It is difficult to obtain a perfect aspiration.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: lha'i rgyal srid ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu lags so //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal srid ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu lags so //
translated: the divine kingdom is a cause for the arising of suffering.

original: gling gcig gi mi rnams kyi rgyal srid kyang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu lags so //
analyzed: gling gcig gi mi rnams kyi rgyal srid kyang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu lags so //
translated: The kingdom of the humans of one continent is also a cause for the arising of suffering.

original: gling gnyis dang / gsum dang / gling bzhi pa'i rgyal srid kyang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu lags te /
analyzed: gling gnyis dang / gsum dang / gling bzhi pa'i rgyal srid kyang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu lags te /
translated: of three continents, and of the four continents, are causes of suffering.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: yun ring por 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: yun ring por 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: they cause one to experience the suffering of cyclic existence for a long time.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: lha dang mi'i 'byor pa ni rlung gi shugs bzhin du g-yo zhing mi gnas lags so //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i 'byor pa ni rlung gi shugs bzhin du g-yo zhing mi gnas lags so //
translated: the wealth of gods and humans is unstable, like the force of the wind.

original: byis pa rnams ni chu zla lta bu'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas ngoms mi myong zhing yul rnams la myos nas lha dang mi'i dpal 'tshal bar bgyid de /
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni chu zla lta bu'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas ngoms mi myong zhing yul rnams la myos nas lha dang mi'i dpal 'tshal bar bgyid de /
translated: Fools are never satisfied with the five sense pleasures, which are like a moon reflected in water. They crave objects and seek the glory of gods and humans.

original: byis pa de dag ni yang dang yang du sems can dmyal ba rnams su gnod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du kun tu gti mug pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang du bkres pa dang skoms pa'i sdug @255a *//
analyzed: byis pa de dag ni yang dang yang du sems can dmyal ba rnams su gnod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du kun tu gti mug pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang du bkres pa dang skoms pa'i sdug @255a *//
translated: Those fools again and again experience the suffering of harm in the hells, the suffering of confusion among the animals, and the suffering of hunger and thirst among the ghosts.

original: bsngal dang / mi rnams kyi nang du sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams kyi nang du 'chi 'pho'i sdug bsngal dang / yang mngal du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gcig gis gcig mgo gcod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gcig la gcig 'tshal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsngal dang / mi rnams kyi nang du sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams kyi nang du 'chi 'pho'i sdug bsngal dang / yang mngal du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gcig gis gcig mgo gcod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gcig la gcig 'tshal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: the suffering of being separated from what is dear in the human realm, the suffering of death and transmigration in the divine realm, the suffering of being in the womb, the suffering of beheading each other, and the suffering of devouring each other.

original: byis pa rnams 'khyams pa na de lta bu'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams 'khyams pa na de lta bu'i sdug bsngal dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they wander in saṃsāra, fools experience such sufferings.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bas ma thob pa thob par bgyi ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bgyi ba dang / mngon sum du ma bgyis pa mngon sum du bgyi ba'i slad du yang dag pa'i smon lam mi 'debs shing rtsol bar mi bgyid pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bas ma thob pa thob par bgyi ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bgyi ba dang / mngon sum du ma bgyis pa mngon sum du bgyi ba'i slad du yang dag pa'i smon lam mi 'debs shing rtsol bar mi bgyid pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because they do not make aspirations and do not strive to attain what has not been attained, to realize what has not been realized, and to actualize what has not been actualized, due to being separated from spiritual teachers.

original: de ltar byis pa glen pa dag ni gang la sdug bsngal thams cad bas par 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis skyo bar bgyid cing gang la yang dang yang du sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'khor bas skyo bar mi bgyid cing yid 'byung bar mi bgyid
analyzed: de ltar byis pa glen pa dag ni gang la sdug bsngal thams cad bas par 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis skyo bar bgyid cing gang la yang dang yang du sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'khor bas skyo bar mi bgyid cing yid 'byung bar mi bgyid
translated: In this way, foolish people are weary of the thought of awakening, which is the state in which all suffering is exhausted, and they are not weary of cyclic existence, in which suffering arises again and again.

original: do // rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: do // rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: de lta bas na 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi snod du gyur pa lags par yongs su brtag pa mdzod cig /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi snod du gyur pa lags par yongs su brtag pa mdzod cig /
translated: therefore, you should consider that cyclic existence is the state in which all suffering is exhausted.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la lhag par mdzad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la lhag par mdzad pa mdzad de /
translated: in this way, you have done a great service to the doctrine of the Blessed One.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni bskrun /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni bskrun /
translated: You have planted the roots of virtue,

original: dkon mchog gsum @255b la dad pa ni brnyes /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum @255b la dad pa ni brnyes /
translated: you have gained faith in the Three Jewels,

original: longs spyod chen po'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la dbul ba ni phul /
analyzed: longs spyod chen po'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la dbul ba ni phul /
translated: you have offered gifts to the Blessed One for the sake of great wealth,

original: mtho ris su skye ba thob par bgyi ba'i slad du tshul khrims ni bsrungs /
analyzed: mtho ris su skye ba thob par bgyi ba'i slad du tshul khrims ni bsrungs /
translated: and you have guarded morality in order to attain rebirth in the higher realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das la chos gsan pas khyod shes rab chen po brnyes par ni gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la chos gsan pas khyod shes rab chen po brnyes par ni gyur /
translated: “You have heard the Dharma from the Bhagavān and have attained great wisdom.

original: mchod sbyin ni mdzad lags kyi /
analyzed: mchod sbyin ni mdzad lags kyi /
translated: You have performed the sacrifice.

original: rgyal po chen po khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thugs skyed cig /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thugs skyed cig /
translated: Great King, you should generate the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: smras pa / bram ze /
analyzed: smras pa / bram ze /
translated: He replied, “Brahmin,

original: kho bo'i ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo'i ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi 'dod de /
translated: I do not want unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bram ze / kho bos ni 'khor ba mngon par 'dod pa'i don du sbyin pa byin cing tshul khrims bsrungs la chos nyan to //
analyzed: bram ze / kho bos ni 'khor ba mngon par 'dod pa'i don du sbyin pa byin cing tshul khrims bsrungs la chos nyan to //
translated: Brahmin, I give gifts, I maintain ethical discipline, and I listen to the Dharma for the sake of manifestly desiring saṃsāra.

original: bram ze / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni thob par dka' ba yin pas /
analyzed: bram ze / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni thob par dka' ba yin pas /
translated: Brahmin, unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is difficult to attain.

original: bram ze / mi dgos so //🔽bram ze rgya mtsho'i rdul gyis rgyal po la lan gnyis su smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze / mi dgos so // bram ze rgya mtsho'i rdul gyis rgyal po la lan gnyis su smras pa /
translated: Brahmin, I have no need of it.”

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: The brahmin Sāgara­druma replied to the king a second time, “Great King,

original: byang chub kyi lam ni yang dag pa lags pas bsam pas smon lam btab par bgyi ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam ni yang dag pa lags pas bsam pas smon lam btab par bgyi ba ste /
translated: the path to awakening is correct, so you should make aspirations with a thought of it.

original: lam de ni sgrib ba ma mchis pas rdzogs shing shin tu dang ba lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni sgrib ba ma mchis pas rdzogs shing shin tu dang ba lags so //
translated: This path is perfect and very clear, because it is free from obscurations.

original: lam de ni lhag pa'i bsam pas rnam par dag cing drang po lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni lhag pa'i bsam pas rnam par dag cing drang po lags so //
translated: This path is straight and pure, because it is free from deceit.

original: lam de ni nyon mongs pa bsal bas g-yo med cing dag pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni nyon mongs pa bsal bas g-yo med cing dag pa lags so //
translated: This path is pure, because it is free from afflictions.

original: lam de ni sgrib pa ma mchis pas rgya che ba lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni sgrib pa ma mchis pas rgya che ba lags so //
translated: This path is vast, because it is free from obscurations.

original: lam de ni bsam pa las byung bas yang dag par gzhol ba lags so //🔽lam de ni sdig pa thams @256a *//
analyzed: lam de ni bsam pa las byung bas yang dag par gzhol ba lags so // lam de ni sdig pa thams @256a *//
translated: This path is well-directed, because it arises from intention.

original: cad mi bgyid pas 'jigs pa ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: cad mi bgyid pas 'jigs pa ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: This path is fearless, because it does not engage in any evil.

original: lam de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par 'byor pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par 'byor pa lags so //
translated: This path is endowed with the perfection of generosity.

original: lam de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsil ba lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsil ba lags so //
translated: This path is cool, because it is endowed with the perfection of morality.

original: lam de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gzhi ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gzhi ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: This path is without basis, because it is endowed with the perfection of patience.

original: lam de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas byin gyi rlabs kyi rten lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas byin gyi rlabs kyi rten lags so //
translated: This path is the basis of blessing, because it is endowed with the perfection of effort.

original: lam de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnyog pa ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnyog pa ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: This path is unruffled by the perfection of meditation.

original: lam de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shin tu rtogs pa lags so; ;lam de ni snying rje chen pos ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa rjes su rtogs pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shin tu rtogs pa lags so; ;lam de ni snying rje chen pos ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa rjes su rtogs pa lags so //
translated: This path is well understood by the perfection of wisdom. This path is realized by the knowledge of the essence of great compassion.

original: lam de ni dga' ba chen pos mchog tu dga' ba thob pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni dga' ba chen pos mchog tu dga' ba thob pa lags so //
translated: This path is the attainment of supreme joy by great joy.

original: lam de ni btang snyoms chen pos snying po dang mthun pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni btang snyoms chen pos snying po dang mthun pa lags so //
translated: This path is in accord with the essence by great equanimity.

original: lam de ni 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag ma mchis pas tsher ma dang bral ba lags so; ;lam de ni khong khro ba'i sems ma mchis pas bgrod bde ba lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag ma mchis pas tsher ma dang bral ba lags so; ;lam de ni khong khro ba'i sems ma mchis pas bgrod bde ba lags so //
translated: This path is free from thorns by the absence of the thoughts of desire, malice, and violence. This path is easy to travel by the absence of an angry mind.

original: lam de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnam par rig pas g-yo dang bral ba lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnam par rig pas g-yo dang bral ba lags so //
translated: This path is free from deceit by the awareness of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: lam de ni khams dang skye mched shin tu mthong bas bdud dang phyir rgol ba nges par bcom pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni khams dang skye mched shin tu mthong bas bdud dang phyir rgol ba nges par bcom pa lags so //
translated: This path is the one that is certain to conquer demons and adversaries by seeing the elements and sense bases.

original: lam de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bas bdud dang @256b bra /
analyzed: lam de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bas bdud dang @256b bra /
translated: This path is the one that is free from all afflictions, and so is free from demons and adversaries.

original: lags so // lam de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bgyid pa dang bral pas sems rgya chen pos mchi ba lags so //
analyzed: lags so // lam de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bgyid pa dang bral pas sems rgya chen pos mchi ba lags so //
translated: This path is the one that proceeds with a vast mind, free from the attentions of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: lam de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas spro ba dang bcas pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas spro ba dang bcas pa lags so //
translated: This path is the one that is accompanied by enthusiasm, being blessed by all the tathāgatas.

original: lam de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che dang mthun pas rin po che chen po nges par sgrub pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che dang mthun pas rin po che chen po nges par sgrub pa lags so //
translated: This path is the one that is the great jewel, which is certain to be accomplished, being in accord with the jewel of omniscience.

original: lam de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes chags pa mi mnga' bas rtag tu bstan pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes chags pa mi mnga' bas rtag tu bstan pa lags so //
translated: This path is the one that is always taught, being the unattached wisdom of the Blessed One.

original: lam de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis rjes su zin pas dge ba'i rtsa ba ston cing rjes su spyad pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis rjes su zin pas dge ba'i rtsa ba ston cing rjes su spyad pa lags so //
translated: This path is the one that is accompanied by the roots of virtue, being attended to by spiritual friends.

original: lam de ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs pas mtho dman dang bral ba lags so //🔽lam de ni gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / khro ba ma mchis pas rdul nges par bcom pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs pas mtho dman dang bral ba lags so // lam de ni gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / khro ba ma mchis pas rdul nges par bcom pa lags so //
translated: This path is free from high and low, for it abandons attachment and anger.🔽This path is the destruction of dust, for it is free from malice, harshness, and anger.

original: lam de ni mi dge ba thams cad dang bral bas bde 'gror mchi ba la sman pa lags so //
analyzed: lam de ni mi dge ba thams cad dang bral bas bde 'gror mchi ba la sman pa lags so //
translated: This path is the medicine for going to the happy realms, for it is free from all nonvirtue.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: byang chub kyi lam de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pas bde ba 'thob pa lags kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pas bde ba 'thob pa lags kyi /
translated: this path to awakening is the attainment of happiness, for it ends in nirvāṇa.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: byang chub tu thugs skyed cig /
analyzed: byang chub tu thugs skyed cig /
translated: generate the mind of awakening!

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: bram ze / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di ni skye dgu lo brgyad khri pa rnams kyi nang du 'jig rten du byung bas na de bzhin gshegs pas ngan song thams cad zhi bar mdzad pa la spyod de /
analyzed: bram ze / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di ni skye dgu lo brgyad khri pa rnams kyi nang du 'jig rten du byung bas na de bzhin gshegs pas ngan song thams cad zhi bar mdzad pa la spyod de /
translated: “Brahmin, since this thus-gone one appeared in the world when the lifespan of beings was eighty thousand years, the thus-gone one’s conduct is to pacify all lower realms.

original: sems can gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i sems can @257a *//
analyzed: sems can gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i sems can @257a *//
translated: Beings who have generated roots of virtue

original: de dag ni 'bras bu la gnas par gyur la las ni ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / bzod pa bsgrubs /
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu la gnas par gyur la las ni ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / bzod pa bsgrubs /
translated: Some of them had attained the meditative absorptions, dhāraṇīs, and acceptances.

original: gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog tu gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur /
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog tu gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur /
translated: Some of them had attained the supreme roots of virtue of bodhisattvas and were irreversible from awakening.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa kha cig gis ni lha dang mi'i dpal nyams su myong bar gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa kha cig gis ni lha dang mi'i dpal nyams su myong bar gyur te /
translated: Some of them had planted roots of virtue and had experienced the glory of gods and humans.

original: sems can rnams rang rang gi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi 'phyan par gyur pas na /
analyzed: sems can rnams rang rang gi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi 'phyan par gyur pas na /
translated: Sentient beings are wandering due to their own virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: 'di ltar sems can gcig tsam gyi sdug bsngal yang rab tu zhi bar ma mdzad na bcom ldan 'das kyis btul ba'i sems can gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gcig tsam gyi sdug bsngal yang rab tu zhi bar ma mdzad na bcom ldan 'das kyis btul ba'i sems can gang zhig yin /
translated: If the Blessed One does not completely pacify even the suffering of a single sentient being, then who is a sentient being tamed by the Blessed One?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ni zhing du gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ni zhing du gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: The body of the Blessed One is only a field.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal las thar bar ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal las thar bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not liberate sentient beings who have not planted roots of virtue from suffering.”

original: kho bo ni byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa'ang spyod la /
analyzed: kho bo ni byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa'ang spyod la /
translated: I have given rise to the mind of awakening and I practice the bodhisattva deeds.🔽I have gathered great wisdom and I have entered the inconceivable great Dharma gateway. With that, I tame beings and I perform the deeds of a buddha.

original: kho bo ye shes chen po bsags pa dang / chos kyi sgo chen po bsam gyis mi khyab par 'jug pa des sems can rnams 'dul zhing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'ang byed mod kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyon mongs pa can 'di lta bur byang chub kyi phyir sems yongs su bsngo ba 'ba' zhig ni mi byed
analyzed: kho bo ye shes chen po bsags pa dang / chos kyi sgo chen po bsam gyis mi khyab par 'jug pa des sems can rnams 'dul zhing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'ang byed mod kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyon mongs pa can 'di lta bur byang chub kyi phyir sems yongs su bsngo ba 'ba' zhig ni mi byed
translated: But I do not dedicate my mind to awakening in a buddha realm such as this, which is filled with afflictions.

original: do // gal te gang gi tshe kho bo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la reg par 'gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der kho bos @257b sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sangs🔽rgyas kyi zhing zhig 'thob par 'gyur ba lta na /
analyzed: do // gal te gang gi tshe kho bo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la reg par 'gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der kho bos @257b sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sangs🔽rgyas kyi zhing zhig 'thob par 'gyur ba lta na /
translated: If I were to attain a buddha realm in which I could pacify all the suffering of beings, and in which I could reach the state of unsurpassed and perfect awakening,🔽then I would do so.

original: de'i tshe kho bo byang chub tu sems bskyed cing kho bos byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'ang spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe kho bo byang chub tu sems bskyed cing kho bos byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'ang spyad par bya'o //
translated: At that time, I gave rise to the mind of enlightenment and practiced the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i snying pos 'di lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad de /

analyzed: de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin me long bkod pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //

analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin me long bkod pa la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / 'di lta bu'i snang ba byung bar gyur te /

translated: That light illuminated all the qualities of the arrays of as many world systems as there are atoms in a thousand buddha realms in each of the ten directions.

analyzed: la la dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / la la dag na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa dang / gang dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi shing drung na 'dug nas bdud pham par byed pa rnams dang / gang dag na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rnams dang / gang dag na chos @258a *//
translated: some in which the Bhagavat Buddha has passed into parinirvāṇa, some in which he has entered parinirvāṇa, some in which the bodhisattva mahāsattva has sat down at the foot of the Bodhi tree and defeated Māra,

analyzed: gzhon nu khyod byang chub tu sems skyed cig ces bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du rgya cher sbyar te /

analyzed: rgyal bu stong gi bar du thams cad byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du bcug go /

analyzed: khams kyi rgyal po brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / gzhan yang sems can dung phyur phrag dgu dang / bye ba phrag gnyis kyang byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa dang / de dag thams cad kyis kyang 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: bdag cag kyang rang rang gi khyim du mchis la gcig pu dben par mchis nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa dag bsam par bgyi'o //

analyzed: gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bdag gir ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‘If I am to complete my domain in unsurpassed and perfect awakening,

translated: may the Blessed One also act in accordance with my wishes.🔽May he perform such a great miracle that the sufferings of all the beings in the hells, the animal realms, the worlds of the ancestors, and the worlds of humans and gods in the great billionfold world system will be pacified, and may they experience happiness.

translated: They saw the body of the Blessed One, well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and beautified by the eighty minor marks.

translated: Those who lived nearby and those who lived far away entered the park later to see the Blessed One and to see the community of monks.

analyzed: bdag tu 'dun pa med /
